description:
Product Identification
USG Ceilings Kitchen Lay-In Panels are a lightweight alternative to vinyl-covered gypsum board products. They meet
USDA/FSIS guidelines for use in food-processing areas, offer high light reflectance, are washable, water repellent,
scratch and soil resistant finish and offer USG’s ClimaPlus™ 30-year limited system warranty against visible sag, mold
and mildew.
This product utilizes a ground wet-felted basemat consisting of perlite, mineral wool, paper fiber and starch. Additional
information regarding USG Ceilings Kitchen Lay-In Panels can be found at usg.com and cgcinc.com. This EPD includes
USG Ceilings Kitchen Lay-In Panels (Square Edge) products produced at Cloquet, MN and covers the following
products: Item nos.: 3210 and 3410.
These products generally fall under ASTM E1264 Section 5.2 designation as Type III-Mineral base with painted finish.
The modifications typically involve modifications to the thickness, density, basemat composition and/or coating package.
1.2. Application
name: Kitchen Lay-In Panels

description: The Fassa Group currently has 13 production facilities in Italy, the most recent located in Calliano, Asti province, one site in Portugal, one in Brazil, 3 sales offices in Italy, three in Switzerland, one in France, one in Spain and one in the UK. FASSA offers a complete product range. One of them is the Gypsotech Externa Light. It is a lightweight fibreglass-reinforced cement board, designed to be applied both on the inside and outside of the building. With its thickness of 12,5 mm, it can be used for the formation of walls, counterwalls and false ceilings. The Gypsotech Plasterboard System features a wide range of products, including plasterboards for various applications, plasters, composite panels, insulating panels and framing systems.
name: GYPSOTECH EXTERNA LIGHT

description: Decoustics offers a wide range of acoustical fabric products that attain exceptional noise absorption levels and offer high customization possibilities to achieve the design intent. Vast array of fabric colors, patterns and textures, digital printing, geometrical and curved shapes, as well as the panel construction are sure to meet your project requirements. All fabrics are tested for durability and acoustical transparency to ensure that you reach the desired NRC levels, and they also meet Class A fire rating on a composite test making them a safe and reliable choice for all applications.
name: Fabric Panel (2 in) MEVAP - Ceilencio Mounting

description: All tests of airborne soundproofing have confirmed its leading position in competition with products used so far. Among them, Gecon Acoustic 10 has unique sound insulation and mechanical properties, as well as a significantly lower purchase price. It is produced by technology developed and protected by the company, which significantly reduces the emission footprint in the production of boards and by 99% recycling various types of input materials that cannot be recycled. In our company, these materials get a second chance and after processing they meet strict EU standards. Our boards are manufactured without the content of substances harmful to health or nature (even without formaldehyde).
name: Gecon Acoustic 10

description:
Nexus wall panels are fabric-finished fiberglass core panels available in five different impact levels. Only four impact levels are considered in this EPD: Nexus Acoustical, Nexus High Impact, Nexus High Impact Ultimate and Nexus Nova. Nexus panels are typically used for wall applications and have resinhardened edges. Nexus Acoustical panels are recommended for areas where panels are not
likely to receive abuse or impact, while Nexus High Impact, Nexus High Impact Ultimate and Nexus Nova panels have an additional layer of protection for use in areas where low to high impact
resistance is needed. These panels respectively have an added layer of high-density fiberglass facer, high-density scrim and perforated copolymer.
name: Nexus 2'' panels

Vast array of fabric colors, patterns and textures, digital printing, geometrical and curved shapes, as well as the panel construction are sure to meet your project requirements. All fabrics are tested for durability and acoustical transparency to ensure that you reach the desired NRC levels, and they also meet Class A fire rating on a composite test making them a safe and reliable choice for all applications.
name: Fabric AP 2"

Product characteristic: Light translucent fabric acoustical panel with Ceilencio grid system. The Ceilencio LightFrame is an accessible translucent acoustical fabric ceiling system that optimizes artificial or natural light transfusion using a precise monofilament fabric. Additional features include:
• Assembled and pre-stressed lightweight aluminum profile• Wrinkle-free, pre-stressed, smooth membrane fabric facing• Free of plasticizers and feature low VOC's• Dirt resistant
name: Decoustics LightFrame Ceilencio Panel

description: Resembling the classic appearance of drywall or plaster, Claro is a malleable product with superb sound absorbing properties. Claro is ideal for areas where indirect lighting is required with a 94% light reflectance on the standard white (CSW-100). The finish is applied to the face and edge of the panels to creating a monolithic appearance. Claro can be color-matched to a wide range of paint chips, pre-curved and custom engineered to attain a vast array of unique shapes and sizes.
name: Claro MEVATT 2"

description:
This Environmental and Health Product Declaration Sheet (FDES) describes the environmental impacts of 1 m² of glass wool ceiling tiles.
Saint-Gobain Ecophon manufactures glass wool using natural raw materials (sand) or recycled materials (cullet) by melting and fibre-drawing. The products obtained are in the form of a ceiling tile composed of a flexible structure and air.
Thanks to its porous and elastic structure, glass wool absorbs airborne noise, impact noise and allows acoustic correction to be carried out inside the premises. The tangled structure of mineral wool also traps air, which provides its thermal insulation capabilities. Finally, based on incombustible minerals by nature, mineral wools do not feed the fire and do not spread flames.
This is a general environmental statement of the Advantage family of products. The values presented in this FDES are based on an average value calculated from the sales statistics for 2016 of the following products:
Advantage A 15mm, Advantage A 20mm, Advantage E 15mm, Advantage E 20mm The results and data of this FDES are not valid for any of the above items but give an average value for the Advantage product family.
name: Ecophon Advantage

description:
This Environmental and Health Product Declaration Sheet (FDES) describes the environmental impacts of 1 m² of glass wool ceiling tiles.
Saint-Gobain Ecophon manufactures glass wool using natural raw materials (sand) or recycled materials (cullet) by melting and fibre-drawing. The products obtained are in the form of a ceiling tile composed of a flexible structure and air.
Thanks to its porous and elastic structure, glass wool absorbs airborne noise, impact noise and allows acoustic correction to be carried out inside the premises. The tangled structure of mineral wool also traps air, which provides its thermal insulation capabilities. Finally, based on incombustible minerals by nature, mineral wools do not feed the fire and do not spread flames.
This is a general environmental statement for the Master Rigid family of products. The values presented in this FDES are based on an average value calculated from the sales statistics for 2016 of the following products:
Master Rigid A, Master Rigid E, Master Rigid Dp.
